document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Paragymnetis chalcipes subsp. undata Olivier
:
Schürhoff 1937: 67
(list; distribution);
Blackwelder 1944: 263
(catalog; distribution).

Gymnetina ( Gymnetoides ) chalcipes undatus (Oliv., 1789)
:
Monné 1970: 61
(distribution; references).

Gymnetis chalcipes ssp. undata : Krajčík 1998: 76
(catalog; distribution).

Gymnetis similis
, not Gory & Percheron, 1833 :
Burmeister 1842: 296
(description; distribution);
Schaum 1844: 363
(correct identification; reference);
Schürhoff, 1937: 63
, =
Paragymnetis burmeisteri
new synonymy .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gymnetis litigiosa
, not Gory & Percheron, 1833 : Tremoleras 1910 . 26 (distribution): misidentification.

Distribution:
HAITI
( Schenkling 1921 ); Santo Domingo, Col. Chevrolat ( Burmeister 1842 ).
BRAZIL
( Gory & Percheron 1833 , Burmeister 1842 , Blackwelder 1944 , Krajčík 1998 ); “Brésil intérieur” ( Lucas 1857 ).
ARGENTINA
( Schenkling 1921 , Blackwelder 1944 , Krajčík 1998 ):
Misiones
: in Bruch Collection ( Bruch 1911a ).
URUGUAY
:
Paysandú
: Tremoleras Collection ( Monné 1970 );
Cerro Largo
: Tremoleras Collection, identified by Bruch ( Tremoleras 1910 ); ( Monné 1970 ).

Material examined:
BRAZIL
: 1 ex. [ HBBA ], “
irregularis
/ G. & P. /
undata
/ [illegible word] / Bras.” [handwritten by Burmeister, pinned to the bottom of the drawer]
;
Minas Gerais : Lavras , 4 exx. [ EAPW ]
;
São Paulo : Ipiranga , X-[year not stated], 1 male [ ODIC ], “
Gymnetis
/
undata
/ Oliv. / [illegible word] determ.”
;
PARAGUAY
: “Para- / guay” [printed on green paper], 1 ex. [ HBBA ]
;
ARGENTINA
:
Misiones
: “Gob. Misiones /
3. IX. 1897
/ C. Bruch ”, 1 female [ CBBA ], “
Gymnetis
/
undata
/ Oliv.” [handwritten by Bruch], “
Gymnetis
/
undata
/ Oliv.” [handwritten by Moser]
;
Dto. Guaraní, Arroyo Pepirí Miní and Río Uruguay , J. Carreras leg.,
25- IX-2002
, 3 exx. [ JCDT ],
27-IX-2007
, 2 exx. [ JCDT ],
20-XI-2010
, 3 exx. [ JCDT ]
;
Dto. Guaraní, El Soberbio, Isla Monteagudo,
6-XII-2007
, J. Carreras leg., 1 ex. [ JCDT ]
;
Pozo Azul, 1 ex. [ EAPW ]
;
Without locality : 1 ex. [ MLPA ], “Def. San. Veg. [printed] /
Gymnetis
/
undata Oliv.
[handwritten]”, “
Gymnetis
/
chalcipes
(G. & P.) / det. B.C. Ratcliffe 2004 ”.

Note 1 : Schaum (1844) establishes that “L'individu de la collection de M. Chevrolat décrit par M. Burmeister est le même qui a servi de type à la
G. undata de Gory et Percheron
, il n'y a donc plus de doute sur l'idendité de la
G. similis , Burm.
, et
undata
, G. et P. Cet individu provenait de l'ancienne collection d'Olivier, où il était noté comme étant sa
Cetonia undata
”. This type specimen was also designated as the lectotype of
Paragymnetis burmeisteri Schürhoff, 1937
, new name for
Gymnetis similis
, not Gory & Percheron, 1833 : Burmeister 1842 ( Ratcliffe 2004 ). Therefore,
P. burmeisteri
is an objetive synonym of
Cetonia undata Olivier, 1789
. The general aspect of this type specimen ( Ratcliffe 2004 : Fig. 13 ) agrees with the specimens referred here for
G. undata
( Fig. 49 ).

Note 2 : Schaum (1844) also states that “L'espèce décrite sous ce nom [
G. undata
] par M. Burmeister n'est pas la
G. undata Gory et Percheron
, ni la
C. undata d'Oliv.
, mais bien sûrement la
G. irregularis
, G. et P.”. One specimen of
G. undata Olivier
in the collection Burmeister at MACN was labeled by Burmeister himself as to “
irregularis
G. & P. /
undata
[illegible letter] / Bras.” (perhaps influenced by the statement of Schaum 1844 ).
Gymnetis irregularis Gory & Percheron, 1833
was later placed in synonymy with
G. undata Olivier
by Schürhoff (1937) .

Note 3 : According to Monné (1970) , the Tremoleras Collection [MLPA] contains specimens of
G. chalcipes
and
G. undata
, but no
G. litigiosa
. Therefore, it seems probable that the citation of “
Gymnetis litigiosa
” from Cerro Largo by Tremoleras (1910) corresponds to
G. undata
.

Note 4 :
Gymnetis undata
is similar to
G. chalcipes
, but it is darker on the pronotum and elytra, and without cupreous shine on the venter and legs ( Fig. 49 ). The specimens of
G. chalcipes
from Brazil (state of Paraná ) are dorsally similar to the
G. undata
specimens examined here, but the venter and legs have a cupreous shine that characterizes
G. chalcipes
. The male parameres of both
G. chalcipes
and
G. undata
are similar ( Figs. 52 and 55 , respectively). The taxonomic status of
G. chalcipes
needs a further evaluation (see in Discussion the distribution pattern of
G. chalcipes
in Argentina ).
